We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Garden City, Ajah - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	The Junior Accountant will support the Finance &amp; Accounts team in daily accounting operations, including bookkeeping, reconciliations, preparation of financial reports, and ensuring compliance with internal controls and accounting standards.
	The role provides an opportunity to gain hands-on experience and develop a career in accounting and finance.

	Post and reconcile transactions in the accounting software (invoices, receipts, expenses, payments).

	Compute, remit and file all PAYE records.
	Filling and remitting all other tax and financial obligations.
	Help ensure compliance with tax regulations and statutory filings.
	Assist during internal and external audits.
	Maintain proper filing of financial documents.
	Any other duties as assigned by the Senior Accountant.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field
	1 - 3 years of accounting experience
	Relevant accounting certification or part qualification (ICAN, ACCA, CPA) is an added advantage.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage)
	Basic understanding of bookkeeping and financial principles
	Strong attention to detail and high level of accuracy
	Excellent organizational and time-management skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Must resident within Ajah and its environ.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrcareerposting22@gmail.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;JUNIOR ACCOUNTANT&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",

Junior Accountant Job at Staff-Recruit




        
    

        
        Staff-Recruit is a leading Human Resource and Management Consulting firm which provides a range of recruitment, selection, outsourcing, training & development solutions. We are a dedicated team of professional consultants offering top of the line executive recruitment and selection services. We cater for the needs of a range of professionals seeking employment and work together to create effective solutions using our networks and strong client base.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Junior Accountant

Job Location: Victoria Garden City, Ajah - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	The Junior Accountant will support the Finance & Accounts team in daily accounting operations, including bookkeeping, reconciliations, preparation of financial reports, and ensuring compliance with internal controls and accounting standards.
	The role provides an opportunity to gain hands-on experience and develop a career in accounting and finance.


Job Description


	Assist in preparing and maintaining financial records, ledgers, and journals.
	Post and reconcile transactions in the accounting software (invoices, receipts, expenses, payments).
	Confirmation of payments made by clients.
	Submission of monthly bank reconciliation statement.
	Managing and disbursing petty cash and office expenses.
	Compute, remit and file all PAYE records.
	Filling and remitting all other tax and financial obligations.
	Help ensure compliance with tax regulations and statutory filings.
	Assist during internal and external audits.
	Maintain proper filing of financial documents.
	Any other duties as assigned by the Senior Accountant.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field
	1 - 3 years of accounting experience
	Relevant accounting certification or part qualification (ICAN, ACCA, CPA) is an added advantage.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage)
	Basic understanding of bookkeeping and financial principles
	Strong attention to detail and high level of accuracy
	Excellent organizational and time-management skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Must resident within Ajah and its environ.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrcareerposting22@gmail.com using “JUNIOR ACCOUNTANT” as the subject of the email.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sales Development Manager",
  "description": "Flexolution NG - Our client (OmniOne, a subsidiary of OmniRetail Africa), is a leading Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) solution provider enabling businesses to digitize, scale, and optimize their operations seamlessly. Our platform integrates enterprise tools, data analytics, and automation capabilities to deliver end-to-end efficiency across industries.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Development Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Ijora, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Business Unit: OmniOne &ndash; A PaaS Subsidiary of OmniRetail Africa
Reports To: Head of Sales / Business Development Lead

Job Summary


	We are seeking a Sales Development Manager with a proven track record of selling enterprise solutions (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Salesforce, etc.) to drive growth and build strong client relationships.
	The Sales Development Manager will be responsible for driving enterprise customer acquisition and building a sustainable sales pipeline for OmniOne.
	You will identify high-value prospects, develop relationships with key decision-makers, and position OmniOne&rsquo;s PaaS solutions as strategic enablers of business growth.
	The ideal candidate understands solution-based enterprise sales and has experience navigating complex B2B sales cycles.


Key Responsibilities


	Drive end-to-end lead generation by researching, identifying, and targeting enterprise prospects.

	Excellent stakeholder management and negotiation skills.

	We are seeking a Sales Development Manager with a proven track record of selling enterprise solutions (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Salesforce, etc.) to drive growth and build strong client relationships.
	The Sales Development Manager will be responsible for driving enterprise customer acquisition and building a sustainable sales pipeline for OmniOne.
	You will identify high-value prospects, develop relationships with key decision-makers, and position OmniOne’s PaaS solutions as strategic enablers of business growth.
	The ideal candidate understands solution-based enterprise sales and has experience navigating complex B2B sales cycles.

Communications Officer Job at Pullus




        
    

        
        Pullus is leveraging on data-driven technology to connect poultry farmers to affordable finance, better markets, advisory services, global best practices and quality inputs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Communications Officer
Job Location: Kaduna
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

            
    




	As a Communications officer at Pullus Africa, your primary responsibility will be to build and promote the company's brand image, increase visibility and support business growth through strategic marketing and effective communication.
	You will play a vital role in planning and executing marketing campaigns, managing digital content and coordinating with internal teams to ensure consistency in messaging.
	You will also develop materials that support sales efforts and engage various stakeholders in the agricultural sector, particularly smallholder farmers, commercial poultry producers and related organizations.


Responsibilities


	Devise and execute comprehensive communication plans aligned with organisational goals.
	Create strategies to enhance the organisation's public image and brand.
	Produce engaging and effective content for various communication channels, including press releases, newsletters, social media,speeches and the organization's website.
	Manage and update content on digital platforms to ensure accuracy and relevance.
	Build and maintain positive relationships with media outlets, journalists and influencers.
	Gather customer and industry feedback to refine marketing messages and strategies.
	Handle media inquiries and arrange interviews, press conferences and other events.
	Develop and implement internal communication strategies to ensure effective information flow within the organization.
	Create and distribute internal newsletters, memos and updates.
	Act as a spokesperson during times of crisis, providing accurate and timely.information to the media and the public.
	Coordinate and execute communication strategies for events, conferences and other organizational activities.
	Work closely with marketing, HR, and other teams on communication initiatives.
	Creates timely reports for all communication campaigns.
	Prepare and manage the organization’s budget regarding communication.
	Conduct surveys or contact people of the target audience to understand their views.
	Ensure effective promotion and coverage of events.
	Oversee and manage the organization's social media accounts.
	Create engaging content and monitor social media trends.
	Ensure that all marketing and communications material align with the brand’s standards.
	Maintain digital media archives (photos, videos).
	Assist Customer Service when necessary.
	Any other duty assigned by the Organisation.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Public Relations, or a related field.
	Minimum 5 years of experience in marketing, communications, or a related role, preferably within the agricultural or agri-tech industry.
	Proven experience developing and executing successful marketing campaigns.
	Strong writing, editing and verbal communication skills.
	Proficiency in digital marketing tools, social media platforms and content management systems.
	Graphic design or multimedia skills are an added advantage.
	Ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
	Knowledge of the poultry industry or agricultural sector is a plus.
	Creativity, attention to detail and strong organizational skills.
	Bilingual abilities are an added advantage.
	Resides in Kaduna.


Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
